section.heading: Kids Ride Free transit subsidy program.

para.text: The Mayor may establish a subsidy program, to be known as Kids Ride Free ("Kids Ride Free Program"), under which District elementary and secondary school students shall receive free fares on the Metrorail system, Metrobus system, and public transit systems operated by the District government.
To be eligible for the Kids Ride Free Program, a student shall be:
A resident of the District under 22 years of age; and
Enrolled in one of the following:
A traditional District of Columbia public school or public charter school;
An alternative, adult, or special education District of Columbia public school or public charter school;
A private school, including a parochial school, in the District;
An education program operated by the Office of the State Superintendent of Education; or
The Mayor may require each student, student's parent or guardian, or student's school to file an application on behalf of the student to participate in the Kids Ride Free Program.
The Mayor may impose a fee for the issuance or replacement of a transit card.

The Mayor may establish standards for eligibility to participate in the Kids Ride Free Program and may impose such other restrictions on eligibility and the use of free fares, including limiting the use of free fares to educational and employment purposes, that the Mayor deems appropriate for the proper operational and fiscal administration of the Kids Ride Free Program.
